page.title: 10THE ENVIRONMENT AND FERRIBY.
page.content: North Ferriby is a "dormitory village" for Hull.Its growth is restricted to the North by the A63, to the East by farmland, to the South by the River Humber,and to the West by a green belt ("The Plantations").The village has a lot of houses so it is becoming crowded.Residents want to stop or limit more houses being built.However people would like some things to be built such as a bigger library because the existing one is too small. They would like a bank so that they do not have to go to Hessle or Hull. When people shop in the village they say they need a car park and also a supermarket to replace Fine Fare, which is no longer in the village.Some old people say they would like to live in bungalows.
